name: Video and Sound
description: This studio course focuses on the use of sound and video to investigate contemporary approaches to the production of time-based artwork. Students will work with analogue and digital editing processes, live sound performance, site-specific soundworks, single-channel video, video installation and video mapping, and will develop a professional portfolio website. Illustrated presentations of historical and contemporary video and sound practices contextualize the skills learned and concepts addressed, alongside readings, discussions and critiques. [144P]
prerequisites: Any two FAS 200 level courses, 1.5 credits in FAH/VCC/VST and P.I.
